page.title: 02Beetham School
page.content: There has been a school in the village of Beetham since the late 16th century. In 1633 the school was located on the site of the present Ashton House. Later it is believed that children were taught in one of the cottages near the church. This would be a dame school. Much later on the school was moved to a permanent building on the edge of the village opposite the present school. This building is still standing and is used by South Westmorland stage and screen society. In 1904 the present school was built on the site of a former toll house,part of which can still be seen forming the entrance cloakroom. The school still has its close links with the church.
